title: The Beat Generation starring Mamie Van Doren
description:
The Beat Generation (1959)
released by Olive Films
Directed by Charles F. Haas

runtime  85 mins.

IMDb:  tt0052610

Cast 

Steve Cochran,
Fay Spain,
Mamie Van Doren, 
Ray Danton,
Cathy Crosby,
Billy Daniels  
Jim Mitchum,
Jackie (Uncle Fester) Coogan,
Vampira

complete cast at the credit roll

Summary  from IMDb

A detective is assigned to track down and capture a crazed serial rapist.
	
  My notes

  Another one from the vault and a similar cast list to "The Big Operator" (1959)  starring Mickey Rooney (good availability on the fileshares.)
I first really saw Steve Cochran in the Don Seigal film "Private Hell 36."
He's played good guys and bad guys and never really got typecast.

  This look back to low budget filmmaking in 1959 leaves the question: Is it a satire on the beatnik fad or a social problems drama?    Certainly the later themes that emerge are serious as they are in "Big Operator" and I save those for the viewer with no spoilers.

   The signature element of a number of these releases is Mamie Van Doren.
One day we may see "Girls Town" but WB is not offering it anywhere. She has the billing but Fay Spain is the most sympathetic character.

   Charles F. Haas has a long resume for television direction: he has at least one credit for virtually every one of the series made by WB for tv in the 50's and early 60's.  I remember many of them and would see more released in video sets.

Notes written April 9th, 2015
